Title: Indian Rebellion of 1857
About: The Indian Rebellion of 1857 was a major uprising in India in 1857â€“58 against the rule of the British East India Company, which functioned as a sovereign power on behalf of the British Crown.

Title: Mahatma Gandhi
About: Mahatma Gandhi was an Indian lawyer, anti-colonial nationalist, and political ethicist who employed nonviolent resistance to lead the successful campaign for India's independence from British rule.

Title: Jallianwala Bagh Massacre
About: The Jallianwala Bagh massacre, also known as the Amritsar massacre, took place on April 13, 1919, when British troops fired on a large crowd of unarmed Indians in Amritsar, Punjab, killing hundreds of civilians.

Title: Quit India Movement
About: The Quit India Movement was a civil disobedience movement launched by Mahatma Gandhi in 1942, demanding an end to British rule in India. It was one of the most significant movements in the Indian freedom struggle.

Title: Partition of India
About: The Partition of India in 1947 led to the division of British India into two independent dominions, India and Pakistan. The partition was a result of religious differences between Hindus and Muslims.
